Equivalent Algebraic Expressions

Equivalent algebraic expressions simplify to the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them.

In the examples above,

\( x + 5 \) and \( 5 + x \) are equivalent algebraic expressions.

We can substitute in any value for \( x \) and the expressions will simplify to the same number.

Substituting in a specific number for the variable in an expression and simplifying the expression is called evaluating the expression.
